description:
Company Description

Are you ready to trade your job for a journey? Become a FlyMate!

Passion, excitement & global collaboration are all core to what it means to be a FlyMate. At Flywire, were on a mission to deliver the worlds most important and complex payments. We use our Flywire Advantage - the combination of our next-gen payments platform, proprietary payment network and vertical specific software, to help our clients get paid, and help their customers pay with ease - no matter where they are in the world.

What more do we need to truly be unstoppable? Perhaps, that is you!

Who we are:

Flywire is a global payments enablement and software company, founded a decade ago to solve high-stakes, high-value payments in education, using modern technology.

Today, weve digitized payments for more than 3,700+ global clients across education, healthcare, travel & B2B, covering more than 240 countries and territories and supporting over 140 currencies. And, were just getting started!

With over 1,200+ global FlyMates, representing more than 40 nationalities, and in 12 offices world-wide, were looking for FlyMates to join the next stage of our journey as we continue to grow.

Job Description

The Opportunity:

Reporting to the Head of National Sales, the Senior Sales Manager, Eastern Canada is a key member of the Flywire sales team. The Senior Sales Manager, Eastern Canada is responsible for leading sales and distribution functions within the Quebec & Atlantic Canadian region. This role requires a high-energy individual with an entrepreneurial spirit, who is relentlessly focused on leveraging Flywires platform to solve complex problems for our clients.

The role operates in a fast-paced environment as part of a dynamic, hardworking, performance-focused sales team. The mandate is to generate material revenue growth through new client acquisition within the Higher Education vertical across Eastern Canada. The role also requires strong internal partnership and cross-functional collaboration across various internal teams including product, partner integrations, global payments & pricing, technology, legal, compliance and marketing.
• Support in the development and execution of Flywires new client acquisition strategies to deliver on sales goals and objectives within the Eastern Canada region.
• Quickly establish and maintain deep client relationships as a trusted advisor to prospective Flywire EUD clients within the region.
• Leverage a proven track record of successfully managing sales cycles and large-scale client deployments in a bilingual (French / English) environment.
• In-depth understanding of Flywires EDU product suite to effectively identify new client opportunities and match Flywires offering to specific client needs.
• Excellent communication and written skills with the ability to lead client presentations and RFP deal teams end-to-end (both French & English languages required)
• Formulate and lead the execution strategy for key industry conferences and events within the Eastern Canada region with a focus on positive ROI through winning new deals, expanding the pipeline and deepening client relationships.
• Responsible for regional pipeline planning and deal support for Relationship Managers to help execute against regional performance objectives.
• Maintain extremely high productivity levels with an emphasis on effective time management and accuracy.
• Maintain strong awareness of trends, competitive solutions, client needs and regulatory considerations.
Qualifications

Here's What We're Looking For:
• Bilingual; must be fluent in French & English
• Experience in Fintech, Payments and/or Banking
• Undergraduate University degree
• In-depth understanding of Payments and FX with prior experience working with financial technology integrations
• Proven track record of winning new business with large-scale client deployments
• Understanding and awareness of payments industry and Flywire product suite
• Excellent analytical and intellectual capabilities; ability to draft comprehensive proposals both in French and English
• Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail is required
• Ability to think strategically and conceptualize ideas in an entrepreneurial manner
• Exceptional communication skills sufficient to provide detailed explanation of factual and conceptual information and ideas to prospective clients
• Proven track record of building strong internal relationships (i.e. product, pricing, technology, legal, compliance and marketing teams).
• Ability to prioritize tasks and create a focus around what is strategically important, is approachable, viewed as a team player and eager to assist in all aspects of the business
• Promotes a culture of teamwork with a personal drive to exceed expectations
• Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced, results oriented work environment with excellent time management skills
• Extensive travel within the region is required
Additional Information

What We Offer:
• Competitive compensation, including Restricted Stock Units
• Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
• Flying Start - Our immersive Global Induction Program (Meet our Execs & Global Teams)
• Work with brilliant people that will keep you on your toes, learn more about their journeys by checking out #InsideFlywire on social media
• Dynamic & Global Team (we have been collaborating virtually for years!)
• Wellbeing Programs (Mental Health, Wellness, Yoga/Pilates/HIIT Classes) with Global FlyMates
• Be a meaningful part in our success - every FlyMate makes an impact
• Competitive time off including FlyBetter Days to volunteer in a cause you believe in and
• Digital Disconnect Days!
• Great Talent & Development Programs (Managers Taking Flight for new or aspiring managers!)

Submit today and get started!

We are excited to get to know you! Throughout our process you can expect to meet with different FlyMates including the Hiring Manager, Peers on the team, the VP of the department, and a skills assessment. Your Talent Acquisition Partner will walk you through the steps and be your go-to person for any questions.

Flywire is an equal opportunity employer. With over 30 nationalities across 12 different offices, and diversity and inclusion at the core of our people agenda, we believe our FlyMates are our greatest asset, and were excited to watch our unique culture evolve with each new hire. #LI-Remote
